Congrats!

Also just watched the Santa Fe interview. Really awesome!

On Tu=
e, May 12, 2015 at 4:48 PM, Jeff Clune jclune@... [neat] <
neat@yahoo=
groups.com> wrote:

>
>
> A huge congratulations to Ken and Joel for this b=
ook coming out!
>
>
> Best regards,
> *Jeff Clune*
>
> Assistant Professor,=
 Computer Science
> Director, Evolving Artificial Intelligence Lab <http://=
EvolvingAI.org>
> University of Wyoming
> jeffclune@...
> jeffclune.co=
m
>
> On May 11, 2015, at 11:05 PM, kstanley@... [neat] <
> neat@=
yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Joel Lehman and I are pleased to announce t=
he publication of our new book
> by Springer:
>
> Why Greatness Cannot Be P=
lanned: The Myth of the Objective
>
> You can get it at Amazon:
> http://ww=
w.amazon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237
>
>
> Or =
through Springer: http://www.springer.com/us/book/9783319155234
>
> As some=
 of you know, Joel and I have long thought that the implications of
> novel=
ty search and non-objective thinking in general extend far beyond only
> ma=
chine learning and evolutionary computation.  From the way we as a
> societ=
y encourage innovation to the interpretation of evolution in nature,
> the =
implications of the objective paradox touch an enormous breadth of
> domain=
s, including of course the now-familiar algorithmic insights.  Our
> new bo=
ok finally gives us the chance to weave all these disparate threads
> toget=
her into a single unified perspective.  As a rare example of
> algorithmic =
insights from AI leading to a broader social and cultural
> critique, we ho=
pe you will find its message inspiring and
> thought-provoking.   Of course=
 we're always happy to hear your thoughts as
> well.
>
> Here's the cover:
=
>
>
>
>
> Best,
>
>
> Ken and Joel
>
>
>  
>

nk">kstanley@...</a> [neat] <<a href=3D"mailto:neat@yahoogroup=
s.com" target=3D"_blank">neat@yahoogroups.com</a>> wrote:</div><br><div>=













 
<div style=3D"background-color:#fff">
<span>=C2=A0</span>


=

    <div><p>Joel Lehman and I are pleased to announce the publication of o=
ur new book by Springer:<br><br><span style=3D"font-weight:bold">Why Greatn=
ess Cannot Be Planned: The Myth of the Objective</span><br><br>You can get =
it at Amazon: <a rel=3D"nofollow" href=3D"http://www.amazon.com/Why-Greatne=
ss-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237" target=3D"_blank">http://www.ama=
zon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237</a></p><p>=C2=
=A0 <br></p>Or through Springer: <a rel=3D"nofollow" href=3D"http://www.spr=
inger.com/us/book/9783319155234" target=3D"_blank">http://www.springer.com/=
us/book/9783319155234</a><br><br>As some of you know, Joel and I have long =
thought that the implications of novelty search and non-objective thinking =
in general extend far beyond only machine learning and evolutionary computa=
tion.=C2=A0 From the way we as a society encourage innovation to the interp=
retation of evolution in nature, the implications of the objective paradox =
touch an enormous breadth of domains, including of course the now-familiar =
algorithmic insights.=C2=A0 Our new book finally gives us the chance to wea=
ve all these disparate threads together into a single unified perspective.=
=C2=A0 As a rare example of algorithmic insights from AI leading to a broad=
er social and cultural critique, we hope you will find its message inspirin=
g and thought-provoking. =C2=A0 Of course we're always happy to hear yo=
ur thoughts as well. <br><br>Here's the cover:<br><div> =C2=A0<br></div=
><img src=3D"http://www.cs.ucf.edu/%7Ekstanley/cover_hires_50pcnt.png" widt=
h=3D"150"><br><br><br><p><span>Best,</span></p><p><br><span></span></p><p><=
span>Ken and Joel<br></span></p><div><br></div>

    </div>
     

    

</=
div>





</div></blockquote></div><br></span><p></p>

    </div>
